DataElement.preferredName: Oral Wash Dosage Form 30 Second Duration Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indication of if the oral wash was done for at least 30 seconds

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Oral Wash Dosage Form 30 Second Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth._A solution or suspension composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) and intended for administration as an irrigant and cleanser._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30_A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour._The period of time during which something continues.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30:A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour.
The period of time during which something continues.
